OSIPI name: Data value at data grid point
Description: The data value at the data grid point $x_i$.
The maximum value of given data.

OSIPI name: Data grid point of maximum value
Description: The data grid point at which the maximum value of a given data set occurs.
The minimum value of given data.

OSIPI name: Data grid point of minimum value
Description: The data grid point at which the minimum value of a given data set occurs.
The value of the data at the last data grid point.
The last point of a given data grid.
The maximum absolute deviation of a given data set from the baseline.

OSIPI name: Derivative at data grid point $x_i$
Description: Derivative of a function _f_ with respect to the independent variable _x_ at the data grid point $x_i$.

The time between the bolus arrival time (BAT) and the maximum time point *xmax*: $TTP = x_{max} - BAT$
(Remark: this is expressed for time rather than a general data grid, because TTP is an often used parameter in perfusion analysis).
The ratio of the difference of the maximum data value $f_{max}$ and the baseline value $f_{BL}$ and the time to peak: $WIS = \frac{f_{max}-f_{BL}}{TTP}$

The ratio of the difference of the maximum data value $f_{max}$ and the data value at the last data grid point $f_{fin}$ and difference between the last time point and the time at which the maximum occurs: $WOS = \frac{f_{max}-f_{fin}}{x_{max}-x_{fin}}$
The integral value of a given dynamic function _f_ (or the numeric approximation for discrete data $[f_{1}, ...f_{n}]$ ) between the data grid points $x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$.

OSIPI name: Quantity not listed
Description: This is a custom free-text item, which can be used if a quantity of interest is not listed. Please state a literature reference and request the item to be added to the lexicon for future usage.
